title: Honoring outgoing President Raymond Cross, Ph.D. after many years of distinguished service to Morrisville State College
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring outgoing President Raymond Cross, Ph.D.
after many years of distinguished service to Morrisville State College

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  acknowledge  the
significant  milestones  in  the distinguished careers of esteemed resi-
dents of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
outgoing President Raymond Cross, Ph.D.  after  many  years  of  distin-
guished  service  to Morrisville State College in Morrisville, New York;
he will leave this  position  to  become  Chancellor  of  University  of
Wisconsin Colleges and University of Wisconsin Extension; and
  WHEREAS,  Upon  earning  a  Ph.D.  from  Michigan  State University, a
Masters of Science degree from Central Michigan University, and a  Bach-
elors  of Science degree from Ferris State University, Dr. Raymond Cross
served as Head of the  Engineering  Technologies  Department  at  Ferris
State  University  in  Michigan, and extensively worked in and consulted
for the auto industry; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Raymond Cross then went on to serve as President and  CEO
of  Northwest  Technical College in Minnesota before joining Morrisville
State College in April, 1998; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 13 years, Dr. Raymond Cross  rendered  faithful,
conscientious and valuable service to Morrisville State College, earning
the admiration, esteem and affection of his colleagues; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  his  inauguration  as  President of Morrisville State
College, Dr. Raymond Cross has guided the institution through  a  period
of  growth,  adding  facilities and programs, integrating technology and
entrepreneurship in academics and reemphasizing the college's historical
strengths in agriculture and technology; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a plan to incorporate technology into the  college
culture,  Dr.  Raymond  Cross  implemented an initiative for Morrisville
State College to take a pioneering role in higher education by integrat-
ing mobile learning via laptops, wireless technology and cellular phones
to allow students to work and learn at  the  location  best  suited  for
them; and
  WHEREAS,  Under  the  luminous direction of Dr. Raymond Cross, Morris-
ville State College  has  increased  its  bachelor  degree  programs  in
specialized  areas;  when  he became President, the College offered only
one bachelors degree in equine studies; today, Morrisville State College
offers approximately 25 bachelor degree programs with four more pending;
and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Raymond Cross played an integral role in the construction
of several new facilities which function as real world learning  labora-
tories  as  well  as  a  move  from  junior college to NCAA Division III
athletic competition, both of which contributed to Morrisville's  devel-
opment into a baccalaureate institution; and
  WHEREAS,  Furthermore,  Dr.  Raymond  Cross  has leveraged Morrisville
State College's roots in agricultural and technical programs, becoming a
leading proponent of using New York agricultural feedstocks  to  develop
biofuels; and
  WHEREAS,  He  has  also  made rural entrepreneurship a priority at the
college with the development of  an  agri-business  center,  small-scale
food processing plant and entrepreneurship institute; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition  to  his  contributions  to  Morrisville  State
College, Dr. Raymond Cross was the chairman of the Agriculture Committee
for New York State and currently, serves  on  several  local  boards  of
directors and SUNY-wide committees; and

  WHEREAS, Dr. Raymond Cross will leave behind a renowned legacy, having
served  with loyalty, honor and distinction, governed by a keen sense of
duty; this remarkable educator always showed a  unique  grasp  of  human
problems in his official acts; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout have been his wife, Miriam, their four
children, and four grandchildren, all of whom feel privileged  to  be  a
part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought  to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  outgoing  President Raymond Cross, Ph.D. upon the occasion of his
retirement after many years  of  distinguished  service  to  Morrisville
State College, and to offer best wishes in all his future endeavors; and
be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Raymond Cross, Ph.D.
